intro: Desmoncus huebneri, commonly known as the horned violets, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Desmoncus huebneri typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking unique and colorful foliage.
